reviewText: I watched this movie over the weekend and can only give it 4-stars because of the handsome and charming Gong Yoo.  The plot of the movie was not very developed, and as such Gong Yoo and excellent job of holding movie together.  The female lead was okay, at least she didn't whine like you often find in Korean Dramas, so that was nice.  I'd recommend this movie only if you are a Gong Yoo fan!
summary: Four Stars because of Gong Yoo!

reviewText: This was a great film to watch if you are looking for an uplifting love story.  It is about a girl who can't seem to get over her first love, and the man who is hired to help her.  Of course, many hijinks follow. Although it is a little zany (and the inevitable rush to the airport scene), the storyline and portrayals hit a soft spot for anyone who has ever been in love and can't seem to forget.  The realistic acting by both lended the film charm and a small bit of angst, but overall it was a sweet little story. Gong Yoo (First Shop Coffee Prince, Big) is an amazing actor, and always lends his characters depth.  Lim Soo-Jong also gifts us with a credible female lead.  I would recommend this to anyone that is a fan of romantic comedy KDramas, or even just romantic comedies in general.
Title: N/A

reviewText: There is a widespread tendency for lovers to place their first love in a compartment of their heart and memorialize it with each new love in competition with that first. FINDING MR. DESTINY exposes this as an unwelcome canard and it does so in the context of a romantic comedy. Ji-Woo (Im Soo-Jung) is dragged by her military father to find her first love from a decade earlier. She goes to a newly opened Finding First Love service run by a recently fired travel agent Gi-Joon (Gong Yoo). It is no easy task to locate one man from a past decade with a name that is a Korean version of John Smith. The two go off looking for the exactly right one and during this hunt, Ji-Woo constantly puts Gi-Joon down for his germ-obsessed fussiness. She is a frequently foul-mouthed extrovert who could not be more different. Slowly the barriers of fussiness and obscenity meld and the two fall predictably in love. This is a romantic comedy so no one should expect logic to hold sway. Instead, we wonder more what Gi-Joon sees in her than in the reverse. What carries the plot is the basic likableness of the leads. In FINDING MR. DESTINY, we learn that in the race to find true love, former first place must always give way to present day last.
summary: First Love Gives Way to Last Love

reviewText: Is there a second chance at love?  This is another great Korean love story!  It is a fun, feel good movie, with a happy ending.  Great script.  Great cinematography, and with innovative story telling!  Great acting!  Great music!  Gong Yoo is a truely gifted actor and he can sing.  He sings a jazz song, "Second First Love" at the end of the movie.  At least two copies of this song are available on YouTube and they contain scenes from the movie, similar to a trailer for the movie.
